alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 9:13AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall that occurred over the Huachuca Mountains overnight is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Cochise. * WHEN...Until 215 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 902 AM MST, Doppler radar rainfall estimates and automated rain gauges indicated that between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain fell overnight over the higher terrain of the Huachuca Mountains. A stream gage in the upper reaches of Huachuca Canyon recently had a rapid 2.5 foot rise (and still rising) and that flow is expected to continue down the canyon toward Ft Huachuca. - Additional heavy rain is possible this afternoon and evening as another round of thunderstorms as expected to develop, potentially impacting the same area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huachuca Canyon into Fort Huachuca. Potential for some, likely non-significant flow could make it to Huachuca City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
